We are so excited to share the incredible cast of Pericles directed by HID's Creative Director, @sophia.c.carlin. Show 'em some love in the comments below!! üíï

It‚Äôs time to go on an epic adventure. Full of everything in the sea, from feisty fisherman to pesky pirates, the story of #Pericles is one that deserves to be told‚Ä¶ from an entirely new perspective. With their joyful and musically vibrant style, #HamletIsntDead takes this story and steers for a different course. Featuring a no boys allowed cast and original music by @sleotacarlin, Pericles asks the question, ‚Äúwhat makes a life worth living?‚Äù

Ticket details coming soon but #SaveTheDate! This is a show you won't want to miss. üåä‚õµÔ∏èüåä

Text reads, "Cast highlight. Ellie Armitage as Gower and Band. Quote: "Pericles is an epic about storms and shipwrecks, love and loss, and what makes a life worth living. What's not to love?"
Cast highlight. Romeo Torres as Cleon, Lysimachus, Third Knight, and Second Pirate. Quote: "The challenge of creating four distinct characters, some with much more text to work through than others-- unreal. The ask at each rehearsal is to be both your most intelligent and most idiotic." 
Cast highlight. Abril L√≥pez as Thaisa and Diana. Quote: "We are really taking sea la vie to a whole new level." 
Cast highlight. Stefania Gonzalez as Understudy for Pericles and others. Quote: "In a rehearsal room filled with laughter and play and grief and groundedness, it's easy to find answers to 'Why live a life?'"
The Center at West Park. October 17th through 26th.

Ok, let‚Äôs address the elephant in the room. Othello is a heavy play full of racial prejudice, misogyny, and fetishization. This infographic just scratches the surface of the discussions we‚Äôve had about race in the play so that we can be our joyful, HIDiotic selves‚Ä¶without making racism a joke. Thank you so much to Farah Karim Cooper for her incredible book #TheGreatWhiteBard which we consider essential reading for the modern Shakespeare artist!
#ImageDescription in comments

#Othello #Shakespeare #HamletIsntDead #HID #Hidiots #ClassicalTheatre #NYCShakespeare #NYCTheatre #NYCActor #ClassicalActor #AntiracistTheatre

In Waiting Room Z, Shakespeare‚Äôs most often forgotten characters find themselves antsy, excited, and lost. It is here that the all-knowing Stage Manager sends them out into the world. However, it‚Äôs been years since these characters have been in the spotlight, and they‚Äôre beginning to grow impatient. Hamlet Isn't Dead's "When My Cue Comes" is a devised play that follows four of these ‚Äúleft-behind‚Äù characters in the canon and their desperate attempts to do whatever it takes to take their place on stage once again.

Helmed by @b.carty23 and devised and performed by @aaronanthonymoore @reidywatson @ladymaudlin @nataliedeboer.actor and @gabrielcethridge we are thrilled to bring this new production to @frigidnewyork 's Little Shakespeare Festival! See us August 2-17 and get your tickets at the link in our bio today!

#Shakespeare #DevisedTheatre #FrigidNewYork #LittleShakespeareFestival #WhenMyCueComes #NYCActor #Hamlet #Tempest #AsYouLikeIt #Hidiots

Our interpretation of Pericles features an all gender-marginalized cast- aka #NoBoysAllowed But this decision was not made on a whim. Learn more about our vision, and get your tickets at the link in our bio- we open TOMORROW!
#Pericles #HamletIsntDead #Hidiots #Shakespeare

Text reads: Hamlet Isn't Dead's Pericles. Why no boys allowed? Quote from Tina Packer's book, Women of Will: "It has taken hundreds of years for women‚Äôs voices to be heard and affect the course of human events. In order for the world to find its healthy balance, all women‚Äôs voices need to be heard." End quote. Text continues: We have taken that sentiment and included all marginalized genders, not just women, in this reimagining of Pericles. Hamlet Isn't Dead has a long history of non-male interpretations, like in the 2017 production of Henry the fifth, the 2018 production of As You Like It, and the 2019 production of Troilus and Cressida. Quote from Olivia Basile, who plays Pericles, "When you're someone in a body or a gender that is marginalized, you're never thinking Pericles is you. The rehearsal process has been a really safe space to engage with a text that I don't think I'd engage with otherwise." End quote. Quote from Jillian Cicalese, Assistant Director, "We‚Äôre exploring a story that is traditionally told with cis men using a better representation of today's artists and discovering how the text translates through those voices. To me, this piece is about finding power in femininity and the relationship between daughter and father. The feminine spirit through the character of Marina brings her father back to life after years of estrangement, trials, and tribulations." End quote. Quote from Sophia Carlin, Director, ‚ÄúThe things that happen to Pericles, the loss of his wife, child, and general uncertainty of where to call home, can happen to anyone. Because we have a focus on centering marginalized voices in this production, their perspectives on these characters are upheld above anything else. My hope is that this process has become a very safe space but also a very soft space in that it is informed by the experiences and needs of the people we've chosen to collaborate with.‚Äù End Quote.

Image Description: Poster for the NYC Fringe production of When My Cue Comes, on a lined notebook paper background featuring a drawing of a woman at a cluttered desk. On the desk is a clipboard and a paper that says "cue sheet" and the woman holds up a bright yellow card with an exclamation point.
When My Cue Comes is directed by B Carty and was devised by Aaron Moore, Gabriel Ethridge, Madeline Parks, Natalie DeBoer, and Reid Watson. Showtimes are April third, ninth, twelfth, and fourteenth at Wild Project. Produced by Hamlet Isn‚Äôt Dead.

Text reads, "Hamlet Isn‚Äôt Dead‚Äôs Pericles. Understudy night October twenty third at seven thirty. Adaline Gomez as Marina and Second Knight, Stefania Gonzalez as Pericles, Audrey Loomis as Gower and Band.
Adaline Gomez is a NYC based actor and sad little poem writer. She has had a blast making her Hamlet Isn‚Äôt Dead debut! Recent credits include the Oresteia with the Gallery Players; Alice Again, Much Ado About Nothing, and Henry IV pt. 1&2 with Stag and Lion Theatre Company; and Jean Jackets and Red Pandas at the NY Theater Festival. She received her BFA from the New School for Drama. 
Stefania Gonzalez is an actress, fight choreographer, and producer living in New York City, originally from Ann Arbor, MI. She has her BFA from the University of Michigan and has also studied Shakespeare at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts. She is known for playing Alicia in The Thanksgiving Play in Palm Springs, CA and Tania in Native Gardens at Meadowbrook Theater, as well as Juliet in R&J inLondon and Marion in the Heart of Robin Hood at UofM. Stefania Gonzalez dot com.
Audrey Loomis is a NYC based actor originally from Austin Texas. Other theatre credits include As You Like It (Amoeba Productions), Cymbeline, Little Women (Quest Players), Comedy of Errors and Measure for Measure (Hoosier Shakespeare Festival). She is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin, and her undergraduate thesis, ‚ÄúUnsex Me: Exploring Gendered Adaptation in Shakespeare‚Äù was presented at the Utah Shakespeare Festival‚Äôs Wooden O Symposium."
